title: Space in Time
segmentation: Hi I'm Florian.
Thanks for the invitation and it's a honor and pleasure being here.
I study architecture in card store and currently I'm based in Berlin where work for arc Plus and I would just.
Scribe like you already did my practice as an architectural story of adventure and exploration becausw
I tried to look at many different things, topics and other disciplines in order to learn something and with this open minded view I think we all have to collaborate on things in the pluralized world.
So I'm trying to offer fresh, radical, and optimistic approaches to towards unbuilt environment and its future future challenges.
With every project I do.
First of all.
I'm convinced that this shouldn't be the only place of work.
And this is not the only tool of an architect.
And that's especially not the only thing he or she can do.
ID.
We believe that with a clever view and Unchained passion.
You
We as architects can.
We gotta change for the better and this is by far.

Following a simple question, which is what if and it describes, it's a central question in the architectural design process, and it's a question to rethink the future of architecture and in combination with the second question, why not and powerful overlap is created and it's a reason for telling speculative stories in order to explore uncommon solutions or let's go.
This is a lie.

Insane by Herrick lit and it means everything flows and I think this this could be the the model of our times because modernity is a world in motion and logistics control this world goods, people, resources, capital data and images move with increasing speed over long distances.
And the logistical modernity replaces natural and urban terrain with undirected space and virtual services.
For example, the virtual online online shop with an invisible logistic center in the background.
And this complexity of human and urban space, however, finds no place here so.
Everybody knows them.
But no one consciously perceive them.
Not even architects in there almost monumental banality.
They line motorways and railroad tracks, and in order to paraphrase Robert Venturi, we're talking about the UN decorated sheds.
And I mean this is about the infrastructural buildings.
And they form a separate category of landscape, which is the logistical landscape is.
I think one of the central tasks of architecture in the 21st century.
Yeah, we all use and love the comfort of online orders and home delivery and due to individual customer requests, the number of parcel transports increases.

But yet the proportion of packages that can be successfully delivered in the first attempt is very low, and this is a development which is completely contrary to the necessary challenge of the reduction of greenhouse gases and energy consumption.
An increasing automation of parcel pickup and dropoff processes can counteract this and at the.
Same time lead to increasing customer satisfaction.
In order to do so both.
Sites need to approach each other and lead to a system which is already established.
The so-called packing station.
But the packing station?
Massage has a huge problem because it's limited in its dimensions, capacity and attractiveness, and this.

Is why I adapted the system as such and designed a cluster of radially arranged parcel silos with the automated two column operator terminal in the center and this could be a much more efficient form.
I was looking for architectural occupations which can be embedded in the void in between and make use of the special features of their logistical DNA.
And the aim is to.
Velop design strategies for programmatically, spatially and architecturally enriched infrastructures, transforming the strategic space of logistics into habitable space.
Which means experience, experience, aghbal, architectural and urban terrain.

So thinking about forms of storage, the silo typology is not only very efficient, but also an aesthetic example of modern industrial architecture, especially a copious was fascinated by the 1st grain elevators and factories in America, and not to forget, look up as you mentioned them as the magnificent firstfruits of the new Age.

When you take a look at advertising columns, you notice the formal dualism between those two typology's and that was the point where I thought about combining both in order to transfer them to the present and re encode them to a new typology.
The so-called Figure tool store.
Um?
In the Middle Ages it was the Market Square.
Before the Millennium it was the shopping street in the city.
Or the shopping mall today.
We have online shopping.

But the future of shopping lies in the Figure Tool store representing the overlap between online and offline world and the term phygital describes the symbiotic relationship between physical and digital soap.
Products of such Phygital storm move between physical and digital space like concepts, but you already saw it before by Tesco or here Amazon go already tried to explore.
Now up to the situation.
My little experiment.
The site is located in car school where I study.
It's a beautiful sunny city in the South of Germany.
Again, Cole has probably doesn't like because you can see here scan page of SML XL.
He he one competition for the center of Art and Media in 1989.
But the city unfortunately refused to realize it.
So my opinion.
Big mistake but net.
The less the yeah, do you do too?
It's in our city location.
The good connections and.
The high commuter traffic.
The main station is an ideal location to act as a prototypical implementation of my figure tool stores.
And those the possible towers also function as a new entrance to the city.
A star is such is.
It's storage and sale at the same time.
S shopping and parcel storage.
Overlay and the classic vendor.
Higher structure is, however, abolished, since the basis of the shopping represent mobile devices and online orders.
He
We can see the underground delivery in order to to fill the towers from below and the coffee ground floor floor which is leading directly to the main station.
Sorry.
In order to compensate the lost aspects of online shopping, buyers can use an app in the sense of share sharing networks.
Users who are looking for the same display to each other and can exchange, for example, wrongly ordered goods can be passed directly if someone else is looking for it.

And the floor can be programmed in many different ways in order to guide you to your parcel, you can sit and rest on benches and talk to each other, and interactive playgrounds and advert advertisement extends right under your feet.
As you can imagine, in this view from above.
Thinking back of the advertising columns, the silo facade consists of a LD point grid which which is decreasing in its density.
And by this the media facade has different appearances from near or far.
And he.
You can see the point grid.

Which is starting with a high density in the lower parts where where you actually stand in front of it and be there you need the higher resolution of pixel points in order to get the sharp image, and at the parts at the top the LD produces a picture with the resolution for faraway distances.
And this is how you could imagine the tower in a switched off condition.
It's like a brutalist monumental shopping temple.
And.
Here it is the facade in switched on and you probably get an epileptic shock.
So to sum.
Up the towers can be used for online shopping.
Pick up and drop off of your parcels.

You get to see personalized advertisement and you have the opportunity for hands on experiences of ordered goods and is for example you can try on your audit things and especially those two last points.
Happen in the space in between the so called space and time.
And.
Interspace is generated by the parcel.
Towers are filled with a wide range of users, which complements the online world and this is like I said before.
This space and time.
You can see just a few examples, it's an overview.
It could be could be even more.
This is a system of private fitting rooms where you can directly get your parcel.
You can try on your new cloth and put it back into the tower if you don't want it.
This is also a fitting room, but designed as a stage where you can present your new things to your friends.
This is.
Public space for art in the city.
You have some snacks and services when you have to wait for your train to come.
And if the train is cancelled, it has too much delay.
You can sleep in the capsule hotel run by Deutsche Bahn.
And.
You can have a drink at the bar with which also uses the towels for storage of their drinks, or you.
Check out some new hot stuff in one of the concept stores and then you can order it online.
You can meet for a coffee and talk with other people about the things you ordered.
And if you feel tired because of the of the world rushing by, you can come down in the peaceful atmosphere of the station Chapel.
Which you can see here.

So talking about future architecture, I think we as architects should be searching for the powerful potentials of architecture facing its current production and trying to unlock new potentials and methods.
I believe in our discipline in a tool for active inquiry and debate.
It's a tool that can highlight and criticise the world we live in at the same time.
Because of that, in the end it's it's all about one thing.
Miss Underwood pointed out back in 1930 when you also talked about the social cultural changes due to the rise of industrialization and its technologies, he said.
Then you time is effect.
It exists entirely independently of whether we say yes or no to it, but it's neither better nor worse than any other time.
The decisive factor will be how we take advantage.
Of these circumstances, thanks.
